questions_answers.question: Does your system offer two-way, out-of-the-box integration with Salesforce?
questions_answers.answer: Yes. NimbusReach Marketing Technologies Ltd provides two-way, out-of-the-box integration with Salesforce, designed to allow seamless synchronization between marketing campaigns and CRM data. This integration ensures that London & Partners can operate efficiently, with real-time visibility of campaign activity and customer interactions. 1. Two-Way Integration Overview NimbusReach’s Salesforce connector allows bi-directional data flow between the ESP platform and Salesforce: • From Salesforce to NimbusReach: • Import leads, contacts, and campaign target segments directly from Salesforce. • Automatic syncing of Salesforce fields such as contact preferences, opt-in status, and custom attributes. • Real-time updates when new records are added or modified in Salesforce. • From NimbusReach to Salesforce: • Push engagement metrics (opens, clicks, bounces, unsubscribes, conversions) back into Salesforce. • Update lead or contact statuses based on campaign interactions. • Trigger Salesforce workflows and reports based on email campaign activity. This integration ensures full visibility of marketing performance within Salesforce and eliminates the need for manual exports or imports. 2. Key Features 1. Out-of-the-Box Setup • Pre-built connector ready for immediate deployment. • No custom coding required for standard fields and campaign tracking. • Supports both Salesforce Lightning and Classic interfaces. 2. Custom Field Mapping • Flexible mapping of Salesforce fields to NimbusReach attributes. • Ability to handle multiple custom fields, data types, and objects. 3. Segmentation & Targeting • Campaign audiences can be segmented in Salesforce and automatically synced with NimbusReach. • Dynamic segments update in real-time, reflecting changes in Salesforce data. 4. Automation & Triggers • Campaign triggers based on Salesforce events (e.g., status changes, opportunity updates). • Automated updates back to Salesforce, ensuring marketing actions are reflected in CRM workflows. 5. Data Security & Compliance • Integration adheres to UK GDPR, PECR, and Salesforce security standards. • Data in transit is encrypted using TLS 1.2+ protocols. • Access controls and permissions mirror Salesforce user roles to prevent unauthorized data sharing. 3. Benefits for London & Partners • Efficiency: Eliminates repetitive manual data exports/imports. • Accuracy: Real-time synchronization reduces errors and ensures up-to-date records. • Accountability: Engagement metrics automatically flow into Salesforce for transparent reporting. • Scalability: Supports multiple child accounts, allowing separate CRM integration per brand if required. • Enhanced Automation: Streamlined campaign triggers and workflows allow for more targeted, timely communications. 4. Implementation & Support • Onboarding: Full implementation support, including setup of the Salesforce connector, field mapping, and account-specific configurations. • Training: User training for both NimbusReach and Salesforce teams. • Ongoing Support: Dedicated technical support for any integration issues, with proactive monitoring to ensure continuous synchronization.

questions_answers.question: Moving dedicated IP addresses must be done with caution. Can you explain how you warm new IP addresses, how successfully you do this, your average time frame for this plan, and if/how you’re able to navigate the transition period were we to have an overlap of providers.
questions_answers.answer: NimbusReach Marketing Technologies Ltd recognises that moving to dedicated IP addresses requires careful planning to protect sender reputation and maintain deliverability. Our approach is methodical, data-driven, and proven to minimise risk. 1. IP Warm-Up Process Our IP warm-up plan is designed to gradually build a positive sending reputation with Internet Service Providers (ISPs): 1. Initial Setup • New dedicated IP addresses are assigned exclusively to London & Partners. • Authentication protocols (SPF, DKIM, DMARC) are verified to ensure proper alignment. 2. Gradual Volume Increase • Sending volume starts small, targeting highly engaged segments first. • Daily send volumes are incrementally increased according to a pre-defined schedule, ensuring ISPs recognise the IP as legitimate. 3. Monitoring and Adjustment • Real-time monitoring of deliverability metrics (bounces, spam complaints, inbox placement). • Adjustments are made to sending volumes and cadence based on ISP response and engagement performance. 2. Success Metrics • NimbusReach has a proven track record of successful IP warm-ups across multiple enterprise clients. • Key indicators of success include: • High inbox placement from the start of the warm-up. • Minimal spam complaints or blacklisting • Rapid establishment of sender reputation 3. Typical Time Frame • The average warm-up plan takes 4–6 weeks, depending on total sending volume and campaign frequency. • For very large senders (e.g., multiple millions of emails per month), we may extend to 6–8 weeks for optimal reputation building. • Progress is monitored daily, and reporting is provided throughout the warm-up period. 4. Managing Overlap with Existing Providers • If London & Partners transitions gradually from a previous provider, NimbusReach can manage overlapping sending periods: • Coordinated segmentation of sending lists to prevent duplicate sends. • Staggered IP warm-up alongside ongoing campaigns from the existing provider. • Monitoring of inbox placement to detect and mitigate any deliverability issues during the overlap. • This ensures continuous campaign delivery without negatively impacting engagement or reputation. 5. Deliverability Safeguards • Dedicated deliverability specialists provide oversight throughout the warm-up and transition period. • Use of engagement-based targeting during warm-up ensures positive interactions with ISPs. • Reporting dashboards provide transparency on inbox placement, bounces, and spam complaints.
